page.title: 10THE RIVER BLACKWATER
page.content: The River Blackwater is one of the liveliest places in Maldon.Many people just visit Maldon because of the bar- ges.They are one of Maldon's famous sights.The barges were used for carry- ing cargoes like wheat,leather,oats, salt and timber but today are used mainly for pleasure.In the Summer they have barge races.The barges have flat bottoms so that they can go in shallow water.Their sails are made from flax. Flax is a creamy colour but they are dyed brown with a mixture of ochre and oil.There is still a firm of sailmkers in the town.The firm has been there for almost a hundred years and they still use old fashioned ways of work- ing.They make sails for barges and also for yachts.They also carry out repairs.
